data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person can go backward to where they started. You cannot go back forward in one direction. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In one turn, you will turn around and make your way back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you return to the starting point, your steps are four and there are only 6 steps left. If you take 6 steps to return to your starting point, you take 6 steps, and if you take 4 steps to return to your starting point, you take 4 steps. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Taking 1 step will return you to the starting point. If 1 step were taken, you can return to the starting point (Take 7 steps). So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning left was the first step before turning right. The total number of steps = 9 + 3 + 3 + 3 = 38. When you return to start, the number of steps is 38. So, the answer is No.

Turn around and turn around again are the same thing. Taking 7 steps goes back around 7 times. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right on the lane with yellow flashing lights at the end of the lane. No, the lane with red flashing light is straight ahead at the start point. So, the answer is Yes.

You can take one step back. You’ d take 2 steps before returning to your starting point. So, the answer is No.

All instructions are the same. They are the same no matter what you faceforward. There are exactly the same steps. So, the answer is No.

Take 3 steps and run north to get 1 step. Take 3 steps and take 9 steps to get 2 steps. Take 2 steps and run east to get 1 step. Take 3 steps and take 7 steps to get 3 steps. No. Thus, the answer is No.

Take 3 steps forward, and you will be face forward all the way. It is easier to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, then you are always forward facing. The first step backward that is taken is the 8th step right. The first step backward is the 8th step left. The last step forward is the 2nd step left. The starting point is always facing forward even if you are 2 steps left of it. The number of steps taken from the starting point is 6 steps backward + 8 steps right + 1 step backward = 16 steps. Taking 2 steps left of the starting point you are now back at the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you start facing forward you will often face the camera first as you make your way through the set. If you face the camera and go backwards you will face the camera first and then the camera. Taking 6 steps left is not the same as taking 7 steps backward to return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

You can take 2 steps right when you face forward. You can either face away from something, or face up. The initial direction is toward the right. The final direction is towards the left. So, the answer is no.
